reason: MISSING STAR-HOMOMORPHISM PROPERTY: For phi(m) to be real when m is self-adjoint, we need phi to be a *-map, i.e., phi(a^*) = overline{phi(a)} for all a. This is NEVER stated in the definition of M-positive state. Without this, even if m = m^*, we cannot conclude phi(m) is real. Either: (1) add phi is a *-map to the definition, or (2) prove this follows from linearity + positivity.
